section.title: High Cohesion
section.para: Cohesion is the degree to which a class has a single, focused purpose.
A class with high cohesion is typically less complex than a class with low cohesion.
We can achieve high cohesion by adhering to the following design principles:

listitem.para: An interface should be split up into multiple interfaces, if not all clients of the interface use all methods of the interface.
